Chapman by the Numbers

Â»
    Facts & Rankings




Numbers matter.
Ours are good. 
That's a fact.
Chapman University is proud of what we add up to. From our rankings in well-respected comparatives, to a tally of what our campus and student body has to offer, we are pleased to share with you what we know about ourself and what other people are saying.




Chapman Is:




#66 (tied) for best undergraduate in teaching – U.S. News & World Report
#121 (tied) in the National Universities group, an elevated category that includes 391 of the leading private and public research universities across the United States, from Princeton and Harvard to UCLA and UC Berkeley – U.S. News and World Report 
#4 of the Top American Film Schools, Dodge College of Film and Media Arts – The Hollywood Reporter
#52 (tied) in Most Innovative Schools - U.S. News and World Report 
#76 (tied) in Best Colleges for Veterans – U.S. News and World Report 
The Princeton Review lists Chapman in its 388 Best Colleges guide
The Templeton Foundation included Chapman in its Honor Roll for Character Building Colleges
#118 (tied) in best law schools category, Dale E. Fowler School of Law- U.S. News & World Report
#60 in best business schools 2023-2024 (full-time MBA), Argyros School- U.S. News & World Report
#92 (tied) in best speech-language pathology programs, the M.S. in Communication Sciences Disorders at Crean College- U.S. News & World Report
#97 (tied) in best physical therapy programs, Doctorate in Physical Therapy at Crean College- U.S. News & World Report
#99 (tied) in best pharmacy schools, School of Pharmacy- U.S. News & World Report











A Snapshot of Chapman U




10,001 students enrolled: 7,656 undergraduate and 2,345 graduate
49 states, 2 territories and 82 countries represented in student population
12:1 student-to-faculty ratio
65 bachelor, 57 minor, 17 accelerated and bridge,  53 master, 6 doctoral programs 
1,117 faculty members
50,000+ alumni worldwide











Student Life



 

20 percent of students are first generation  
40 percent of students identify as Persons of Color (POC)
175+ student organizations
40:60  male-to-female ratio
92 percent of first-year students live on campus; 89 percent stay on campus during second year
42 percent of students study abroad








Chapman Athletics




21 intercollegiate teams competing in NCAA Division III
500+ student athletes
3.34 average cumulative GPA of student-athletes
19 regional titles















Facts & Rankings


Accreditation at Chapman






Fast Facts


Location: Orange, California
School Colors: Chapman Red and Panther Black
Mascot:  Pete the Panther
Founded: 1861 as Hesperian College in Woodland, California
